result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L. Boyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (>$500 - $5000)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and maintain employment approved by his agent.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: the Black River Falls Walmart.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Fully cooperate with the prosecution of his co-defendant, Debra Terwilliger.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian L. Boyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant plead guilty to Count 1.  Court reviewed plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood. Felony firearm possession and voting warnings given.  Defense stipulated to factual basis.  Court found that the defendant freely voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea, and waived his constitutional rights.  Factual basis exists.  Found guilty as plead to.   ADA recommended 3 years probation.  Conditions:   No contact with Walmart in Black River Falls, WI.   Restitution & surcharges.  Seek and maintain employment, not to terminate without agent's prior approval.  Fully cooperate with prosecution of his co-defendant.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   Attorney Fredrickson agrees and this is a joint recommendation.  Defendant elected to not exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 3 years probation.  Conditions:  No contact with Walmart in Black River Falls, WI.   $27.33 restitution & surcharges. CC and DNA surcharge.  Seek and maintain employment approved by his agent. Fully cooperate with prosecution of his co-defendant Debra Terwilliger.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.
Defense agrees to proceed without information being filed.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Court reviewed form with defendant.  Defendant stated he understood the waiver.  Court found defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his preliminary hearing.
ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Plea/sentencing set for 4/20/15 at 1:30 pm

Status conference at 03-30-2015 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 03-11-2015 10:00 am.
Not to be on premises of Wal-Mart Store property in Black River Falls WI.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared with counsel Paul Fredrickson.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives it's reading; waives time limits for preliminary hearing and requests pretrial and status dates.  Court quesstions defendant regarding waiving time limits and finds he freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waived the time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Pretrial set for 3-11-15 and status 3-30-15 at 3:00.  Bond amended.
Not to be on premises of Wal-Mart Store property in Black River Falls WI.

Pre-trial conference at 03-11-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 03-30-2015 03:00 pm.
